intro: Erysimastrum ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian erysimastrum, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, clustered blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
